Finally Tecmo Releases a Classic Arcade Compilation for PS2! (in Japan)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2004 Topics (Year of the Venture): Finally Tecmo Releases a Classic Arcade Compilation for PS2! (in Japan)
By Lisa Shock on Monday, September 13, 2004 - 10:43 pm:

I've been asking for this for years now, and finally they listened! Tecmo is releasing a PS2 title in Japan, called Tecmo Hit Parade. It's seven classic arcade games: Star Force, BombJack, Solomon's Key, Tecmo Cup (soccer), Pinball Action, Senjyo, and Pleiads. If you click the game logos on the link above, you will see info on that particular game. Now if they'd only release a puzzle game collection....

By orangestar on Tuesday, September 14, 2004 - 05:26 am:

Congratulations Lisa!

By orangestar on Tuesday, September 14, 2004 - 05:27 am:

too bad I still don't have a PS2.. But anyways, I'll live

By mepersoner on Tuesday, September 14, 2004 - 10:45 pm:

They should release just classic nintendo games. Games like Rygar and Gaiden..

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, September 15, 2004 - 02:03 pm:

That would be cool, but Tecmo was a huge innovator in arcade games, back in the day. Games like Silkworm, Tecmo Knight, Football Fighter and Tee'd Off Golf all changed gaming forever. I guess I'd like to see a series of compilations, but right now, since this product is already in production for Japan, it's our best hope for the company to test the US waters for a classics compilation. Hopefully this will sell well, and pave thew ay for more!
